content.title: 'You are the reason I am proud': Mother of native title Bonita Mabo farewelled at state funeral - ABC News
Hundreds farewell Bonita Mabo, indigenous activist, icon at state funeral at Townsville Stadium - The Mercury
content.desc: A STATE funeral is being held for indigenous activist Bonita Mabo at Townsville Stadium.

content.title: Townsville honours legacy of Bonita Mabo at state funeral - The Mercury
content.desc: One thousand people have turned out in Townsville, Queensland, to farewell Indigenous activist Bonita Mabo at a state funeral. Dr Mabo worked alongside her ...

content.title: Family speak at the funeral of Dr Bonita Mabo - ABC News
content.desc: Close to 1000 people attended the funeral in Townsville to farewell Dr Mabo, who died late last month at the age of 75.

content.title: ‘Mother of native title’ bid farewell - The Australian
content.desc: Bonita Mabo was remembered at a state funeral in Queensland yesterday as an indigenous and South Sea Islander activist and the “mother of native title’’. Hundreds of people attended the service in Townsville for Dr Mabo — the widow of land rights campaigner Eddie Koiki Mabo — who died last week just days after being awarded an honorary ­doctorate of letters from James Cook University. She campaigned alongside her late husband during his long fight for indigenous land rights and spent 10 years on the Central Queensland Land Council. Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk described Dr Mabo ...
